CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Topics.​TopicGroup
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Topics.​TopicGroup

A class to store information about a group of consecutive Topics in a list.

Restrictions

  • The group can start with a group topic, but it's not required.  However, it must not contain any group topics beyond that.

  • All topics must be in the same class.

  • It cannot contain topics that start a scope.

Functions
TopicGroup
public TopicGroup (
List<Topic> topics,
int startingIndex,
int count
)

Creates a new topic group from the passed section of the list.  Make sure all topics in the group follow the Restrictions.

MembersChanged
public void MembersChanged ()

Call whenever you change the members of the group.

ToString
override public string ToString ()

This is only available to aid debugging in Visual Studio.  When you have a list of objects it puts the result of ToString() next to each one.  You should not rely on it for anything else.

Protected Functions
Validate
protected void Validate ()

Makes sure all the members follow the Restrictions.  Throws an exception if not.

CalculateProperties
protected void CalculateProperties ()

Recalculates DominantTypeID, MixedTypes, and TitleMatchesType.

Properties
Header
public Topic Header { get }

The group topic, if one exists.  Null otherwise.

Title
public string Title { get }

The title of the group, if one exists.  Null otherwise.

StartingIndex
public int StartingIndex { get; internal set }

The index of the first member of the group.  If you change this in a way that changes which topics are part of the group (as opposed to changing it to reflect shifting indexes due to changes in the topic list) you must also call MembersChanged().

Count
public int Count { get; internal set }

The number of members in the group.  If you change this, you must also call MembersChanged().

IsEmpty
public bool IsEmpty { get }

Whether the group has any topics other than the header.

MixedTypes
public bool MixedTypes { get }

Whether this group has more than one comment type ID.

DominantTypeID
public int DominantTypeID { get }

If MixedTypes is true, this is the comment type ID that appears the most.  If it's false, this is the comment type ID of all the members.

TitleMatchesType
public bool TitleMatchesType { get }

Whether the group's Title matches the name of the DominantTypeID.

ParentList
public List<Topic> ParentList { get; internal set }

The list of Topics the group appears in.

Variables
topics
protected List<Topic> topics

The list of topics the group appears in, but the entire list is not the group.

header
protected Topic header

The group header, or null if this is a group without one.

startingIndex
protected int startingIndex

The index of the first Topic in the group.  If header is defined, it will be the index of that.

count
protected int count

The number of Topics in the group.

mixedTypes
protected bool mixedTypes

Whether the group has more than one comment type in it.

dominantTypeID
protected int dominantTypeID

The comment type ID of the dominant type in the group.  If mixedTypes is false, all of the topics will be of this type.

titleMatchesType
protected bool titleMatchesType

Whether the group title matches the name of the dominant comment type ID.

recalculateProperties
protected bool recalculateProperties

If true, it means mixedTypes, dominantTypeID, and titleMatchesType need to be recalculated.
